info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:46PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Granite and central Powell Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 546 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Drummond, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Drummond and New Chicago. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 152 and 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
